intro: Centaurea toletana, commonly known as Toletan knapweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy appearance. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Centaurea toletana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
